botanical_details.genus: Rosa can be deciduous or semi-evergreen shrubs or scrambling climbers, with usually thorny stems bearing compound pinnate leaves and solitary or clustered flowers. Flowers may be followed by showy red or purple fruits in some varieties.
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Rambler roses are vigorous shrubs with long, arching, thorny or smooth stems carrying glossy foliage and large sprays of small, single or double, often fragrant flowers in early summer

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow on a pergola, arbour, or other airy structure (to reduce the risk of mildew) in moist but well-drained soil in full sun or partial shade; see rose cultivation for more advice
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by hardwood cuttings in autumn or by T-budding and grafting in summer
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to rose aphid, rose leafhopper, large rose sawfly, rose leaf-rolling sawfly and leaf-cutter bees
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to rose powdery mildew, black spot and rose rust
